keywords.indexterm: How to edit view propertiesWorkspace view properties

context.p: Edit the properties for the table view to select what data must display.

step.cmd: In the table view title bar, click Properties.
In the Query tab, Click here to assign a query.
step.info: Queries determine from which attribute group to draw data. The Select Query window opens.

step.cmd: In the Query tree, expand the Marvel Enterprise Monitoring Server branch, then Managed System.
Select Current Managed Systems Status and click OK.
step.info: Back in the Query tab, you can see a preview of the table.

step.cmd: Click the Filters tab and clear the boxes for these columns (attributes): HostAddress, Affinities, Host Info.
step.info: Filters is where you specify the attributes to include in the table and, if you like, show only those values that fall within a range.

step.cmd: Click Test to see a preview of your changes.
Click the Thresholds tab to specify a threshold.
In row 1, click the colored column and select Informational. This will be the background color of the cell when the threshold expression becomes true.
In row 1, click the Status cell, then the arrow, and select OFFLINE from the list.
step.info: Any managed systems that are offline will have this background color.

step.cmd: Click the Style tab to change the appearance of the table.
In the Header, type the following title in the Title text box: Marvel Enterprise Monitoring Agent Status.
